sect1.title: LOOP

row.entry: An integer expression specifying the number of times to iterate .

The operation to iteratively perform. This may be a PROJECT, JOIN, or other such operation. ROWS(LEFT) is always used as the operation's first parameter, indicating the specified dataset is the input parameter.
Optional. Specifies parallel execution of loop iterations. This option is available only on Roxie.

A logical expression that specifies the set of records whose processing is not yet complete. The set of records not meeting the condition are no longer iteratively processed and are placed into the final result set. This evaluation occurs before each iteration of the loopbody.
A logical expression specifying continuing loopbody iteration while TRUE.

A logical expression that specifies a single record whose processing is complete. The record meeting the condition is no longer iteratively processed and is placed into the final result set. This evaluation occurs during the iteration of the loopbody.

sect1.para: The LOOP function iteratively performs the loopbody operation. The COUNTER COUNTER is implicit and available for use to return the current iteration.

sect2.title: The PARALLEL Option
sect2.para: The PARALLEL option allows multiple loop iterations to be executed in parallel.
There is a restriction: ROWS(LEFT) cannot be directly used in a sub-query of the loopbody.
